Articles.Content:
I can't wait!

Then wait no longer! I'm just running it through a final bug check and in the meantime I am preparing the other release stuff like editing posts and spaceport. It will be up within the hour, unless I discover something horribly wrong.

EDIT: Released!

Ooooh

Now all it needs is a flux capacitator.

Or wait

No

That's not it xP

Chamelon Circut!

Edit: Wow, I guess this shows that I don't like the mobile app. I replied in the same thread twice, instead of the release one.

Edited September 16, 2013 by StarVision
Can anyone guess what this is?
Hah, Mr Weasley' flying Ford Anglia

"Yes, Arthur, cars. Imagine a wizard buying a rusty old car and telling his wife all he wanted to do with it was take it apart to see how it worked, while really he was enchanting it to make it ......"
DOH!....Beaten by seconds...lol
I just have to figure out wheels, and how to produce lift, as I seem to be doing something wrong. But anyways, I should sleep. I'll work more on it tomorrow if I don't have other work to do.
You can just give the wheels deflectionLiftCoeff if you want them to act like wings (as demonstrated with LiftCubes here)

You can just give the wheels deflectionLiftCoeff if you want them to act like wings (as demonstrated with LiftCubes here)

Thanks, I figured it out. I just had to change the dragmodeltype to override and it fixed my problem.

(I think my post was deleted because it was posted in the small window when the forums re-opened, and then hacked.)

I've made the main model and I think it'll stay the way it is. I'm just not sure whether or not to have an internal or not. I could have one with fancy props and opaque windows, or I could have no internal and just have external command seats, with clear windows.

Another possibility is to look into the SFR plugin, although I'm not sure how that works. But anyways, here's a video of the current status:

(Three posts in a row now, I'm getting worried)

I've managed to re-texture the stock wheels and tinker with some CFG stuff. All that's left now is texturing the car itself, and possibly an internal.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

For what it's worth, I'd like to see the Defiant next, complete with landing gear if possible. Or perhaps Voyager, also with landing gear. And cargo/shuttle bays on both too. Just sayin'.

The Ford Anglia... okay, it's cute, but to me it doesn't fit this game at all. The Harry Potter series is about MAGIC, which has nothing to do with science or physics or rocketry whatsoever. At least with the TARDIS, that's based on science fiction, although I still fail to see the appeal of flying around in a rocket-propelled blue box, which makes no sense either.

Anyway, all I'm saying is that I'd like to see you stick to making actual spaceships, that's all.

All of the above are my opinions, worth what you paid for them.

For what it's worth, I'd like to see the Defiant next, complete with landing gear if possible. Or perhaps Voyager, also with landing gear. And cargo/shuttle bays on both too. Just sayin'.

The Ford Anglia... okay, it's cute, but to me it doesn't fit this game at all. The Harry Potter series is about MAGIC, which has nothing to do with science or physics or rocketry whatsoever. At least with the TARDIS, that's based on science fiction, although I still fail to see the appeal of flying around in a rocket-propelled blue box, which makes no sense either.

Anyway, all I'm saying is that I'd like to see you stick to making actual spaceships, that's all.

All of the above are my opinions, worth what you paid for them.

Fair enough, This was more something that I wanted myself, then others probably wanted. I think I'll finish it this week, there's not much left to do. After I still have to do the internals for both Enterprises. I might do the original Enterprise first, then something like the defiant, and then after that the Enterprise D bridge.
I like the car! We could use some magic from time to time.

Well, I'd thought that I'd give a little progress update.

I've had birthdays to attend and homework so that's cut down my spare time quite a bit, and I'm going on a trip tomorrow until Friday. I have however got some stuff done.

I textured parts of the exterior, and have fleshed out the dash a lot. One thing completely unrelated is that I have SOUND!

I was looking at the Firespitter parts pack and got it all working. The source had the exact thing I was looking for and as the licence says, I just need to rename the class/module to avoid conflicts. So I installed visual basic 2012 and got it done. Credit will of course be given in the release/dev threads and the download.
Nice, as long as you don't hit a tree.

Nice, as long as you don't hit a tree.

Hehe, I think the results would be much nicer in Kerbal than the movie.

I've fully integrated the sounds now, and made an "Anti flip device", which is basically overpowered RCS. except It's only one direction. For the Starships I've managed to get bridge loops so instead of some poor warp sound, you hear the actual bridge looping. This of course will be a lot cooler when each ship has it's own IVA. The Tardis is limited to its signature sound, no humming ambiance, but it's still awesome.

For what it's worth, I'd like to see the Defiant next, complete with landing gear if possible. Or perhaps Voyager, also with landing gear. And cargo/shuttle bays on both too. Just sayin'.

The Ford Anglia... okay, it's cute, but to me it doesn't fit this game at all. The Harry Potter series is about MAGIC, which has nothing to do with science or physics or rocketry whatsoever. At least with the TARDIS, that's based on science fiction, although I still fail to see the appeal of flying around in a rocket-propelled blue box, which makes no sense either.

Anyway, all I'm saying is that I'd like to see you stick to making actual spaceships, that's all.

All of the above are my opinions, worth what you paid for them.

I agree with you, I would love the defiant.

And I attempted Voyager once- never managed to get it to damn VTOL.

I saw it a while back, and just a little while ago as well. I don't think he ever got around to finishing it though, due to some error he was having.

I actually fixed the issue back in .17, it was as simple as figuring out layers in Unity. I lost interest but hey I'm going to finish it probably now. I'm probably going to do Smiths tardis iva. But man you outclass me at this.
Will u be able to drive the ford around normally like a rover?
Any plans for a flying '64 Chevy Malibu?

Have you thought of making the Phoenix from First Contact?

The Titan II is already made by FASA, so you'd only need to do the Phoenix itself. Would work great with KSP Interstellars FTL propulsion.

Will u be able to drive the ford around normally like a rover?

Yes.

Any plans for a flying '64 Chevy Malibu?

Unfortunately not.

Have you thought of making the Phoenix from First Contact?

The Titan II is already made by FASA, so you'd only need to do the Phoenix itself. Would work great with KSP Interstellars FTL propulsion.

Well, someone else was already planning on making that, but seeing as it's been months I think I'll try tackling it anyways.

Here's the current "To-Do" list.

1: Finish Ford Anglia (texturing, internal)

2: Start Enterprise IVA

3: Something else (Phoenix or UFO. I''ll of had enough bridge internals by now.)

4: Start Enterprise D IVA

5: Unknown (Defiant maybe?)

Progress has been slow, due to a combination of school, more birthdays, homework, and my own laziness. I think once I finish this project the pace will pick up, this not being Sci-Fi and all. Here is a picture of the IVA in Unity. I don't have to boot up KSP right now. I might do some more texture work around the dash, to distinguish the shape more. Notice the "Invisibility Booster" near the top.
